name: (2-hydroxyethyl)hydrazine
Reason: The molecule (2-hydroxyethyl)hydrazine contains an alkane chain (ethyl group), an alcohol group (hydroxyl group), and a hydrazine moiety. Each of these will affect the melting point in different ways. The ethyl group would tend to lower the melting point due to increased flexibility of the molecule (-5 degrees). Hydroxyl groups usually increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding (+100 degrees). However, the hydrazine part of the molecule also has a strong potential for intermolecular hydrogen bonding, possibly even stronger than a typical alcohol, which would further increase the melting point (+50 degrees). Considering the net effect of all these functional groups and their respective contributions to intermolecular forces, the predicted melting point will be the sum of these effects.
